segments.text: I notice the water pouring out of the sink, creating a mess on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just running and running, with no one to stop it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right there, but she doesn't even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the puddle growing larger, spreading across the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost like a slow-motion disaster, unfolding right before my eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are too busy with their cookie mission to care about the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for someone to notice the overflow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, a stark contrast to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of urgency, like I need to do something to stop the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I'm just an observer, unable to intervene.
segments.speaker: PAR
